link.heading: Publication Output of Indian Journal of Traditional Knowledge: A Bibliometric Analysis
link.authorDes: 1Associated Professor, Department of Library & Information Science, University of Delhi, E-mail: kpsingh330@gmail.com2Research Scholar, Department of Library & Information Science, University of Delhi, E-mail: arora.hca@gmail.com
link.abstract: The study highlights results of bibliometric analysis of 671 articles published during the period 2009–2014 (six years) in the Indian Journal of Traditional Knowledge published by CSIR-National Institute of Science Communication and Information Resources (CSIR-NISCAIR). The study examines various bibliometric parameters such as authorship pattern, geographical distribution, reference pattern, types of publications cited, subject distribution and length of articles. The results indicate that majority of the articles produced by universities and majority of the papers were contributed by two authors.
link.keywords: Traditional knowledge, Bibliometrics, Indigenous knowledge, Citation analysis, Authorship pattern, NISCAIR.

link.heading: Matrimonial (Socio-Economic) Choice and Bradford's Law: A Study
link.authors: Ray Partha Pratim1, Sen B K2
link.authorDes: 1Deputy Librarian, Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan-731 235, West Bengal, E-mail: raypartha1@hotmail.com2Chairman, Member, Expert Committee on Bibliometrics, Department of Science & Technology, Government of India, Research Council on History of Science, Indian National Science Academy, New Delhi, E-mail: bksen1938@gmail.com
link.abstract: Marriage acts as foundation of society through social and legal union of men and women. In social marriage socioeconomic choice plays a pivotal role. Among many other sources of disseminating information about marriage matrimonial advertisements in newspapers serves as information sharing communication process in social marriage. In this study socioeconomic choice of 600 each of bride and bridegroom in matrimonial advertisements in two leading Bengali newspapers (Anandabazar Patrika and Bartaman Patrika) were analyzed to check whether the data follow Bradford law of scattering. It is observed from the study that socioeconomic choice of both bride and bridegroom strictly follows Bradford law in the first and second zones but marginally deviates in the third zone. This study may open up new vistas of sociological research in the form of sociobibliometrics.
link.keywords: Bradford law, Matrimonial advertisements, Socioeconomic choice, Bride, Bridegroom, Sociobibliometrics.

link.heading: Conservation and Preservation of Manuscripts in Rampur Raza Library, Uttar Pradesh: An Overview
link.authorDes: Research Scholar, Venkateshwara University, Gajraula-Amroha, (UP). Email: zmahmood@jmi.ac.in
link.abstract: The manuscripts are important to human society. Scholars can measure the value of valuable collection, which they are able to access them. The Rampur Raza Library, Rampur has a good collection of manuscripts in Hindi, Sanskrit, Punjabi, Persian, Arabic, Pushto and Urdu. The collection also includes Art objects, astronomical instruments, Mughal miniature paintings, Islamic calligraphy and historical coins. Some measures have been taken for the preservation and conservation of these precious items for the benefits of future generations. This study examines the status and management of manuscript collection, services and specially conservation and preservation of the manuscripts.
link.keywords: Oriental Collection, Management, Conservation, Preservation, Manuscripts.

link.heading: Publication Trends in Library and Information Science: A Bibliometric Analysis of Library Herald
link.authors: Parameshwar S1, Goutami2, Patil D B3
link.authorDes: 1UGC-Post Doctoral Fellow, Dept. of Library & Information Science, Gulbarga University, Kalaburagi-585106, Karnataka, India, Email: gsparameshwar@gmail.com2City Central Library, Jagat Circle, Kalaburagi-585101, Email: goutamipm@gmail.com3Professor & Chairman, Dept. of Library & Information Science, Gulbarga University, Kalaburagi-585106, Karnataka, India Email: db_patil@rediffmail.com
link.abstract: The paper brings out the results of a bibliometric analysis of the journal titled “Library Herald” for the period from 2006 to 2015. The data were downloaded from the Indian Citation Index database. This study aims at analyzing the research output performance of Library scientists on library & information science subjects. The paper analyzes a citation study of 224 Articles (70 times cited) were published from 2006 to 2015 in the Library Herald. The paper covers the bibliometric analysis of year-wise publication of articles, authorship pattern, institution-wise publication of contributions, state wise, city wise and country wise publication of articles. The result showed that out of 224 articles multiple authors contributed 56.70%, while the rest 43.30% articles were contributed by single author. Further, study also examines the length of articles and average number of references in the articles
link.keywords: Bibliometric study, Library Herald, Publication Trends, Authorship pattern, Geographical distribution.

link.heading: Shodh Bhagirathi: The Institutional Repository of ETD at IIT Roorkee
link.authors: Soni Ramniwas1, Ram Sudeshwar2, Singh Yogendra3
link.authorDes: 1Assistant Librarian, Mahatma Gandhi Central Library, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee2Assistant Library & Information Officer, Mahatma Gandhi Central Library, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee3Retired Librarian, Mahatma Gandhi Central Library, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, mail:yogi5240@gmail.com
link.abstract: We present a case study of developing an e-Repository of the Theses and Dissertations (T&D) in Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (IITR). It will give a brief introduction of the issues which had been considered while setting up an ETD repository such as, digitization process, standards and parameters used in scanning, formats used, indexing of scanned data, in-house v/s outsourcing, software selection, hardware requirements, storage, metadata creation, content management, IPR policy, accessibility and management of electronic content, quality of digital contents, cost analysis etc. This paper also highlights the challenges and opportunity before the library professionals to set up ETD repository using open source software.
link.keywords: E-Repository, ETD-IIT Roorkee, T & D collection, Mahatma Gandhi Central Library, Roorkee, Shodh Bhagirathi.

link.heading: News & Events
A Survey of Prison Inmates’ Utilisation of Library Media Resources in Preparation for Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination in Nigeria
link.authors: Busayo Isaac Oluwadare1, Prof. Elaturoti David Folorunso2
link.authorDes: 1Principal Librarian, FUOYE Library, Federal University, OyeEkiti, Ekiti State, Nigeria, E-mails: Isaac.busayo@fuoye.edu.ng, iobusayo@yahoo.com2Centre for Educational Media Resource Studies, Faculty of Education, University of Ibadan, Ibadan, Nigeria, E-mail: davidelaturoti@yahoo.com
link.abstract: This study takes a cursory look at prison inmates’ utilisation of library media resources in preparation for Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination in Nigeria from 2009 to 2013. Three of the prisons that prepare and register inmates for these Examinations were randomly selected for the study. These are Abakaliki prisons in the South-East, Ikoyi prisons in South-West and Kuje prisons in North-Central Nigeria. A total of five hundred questionnaires were administered on the inmates registered for SSSCE in the various prisons sampled, namely: Abakaliki 160 inmates with a response rate of 142, Ikoyi 240 inmates with a response rate of 209 and Kuje 100 inmates with a response rate of 87. However, 438 questionnaires were duly completed and returned, and found useable for the study, representing a response rate of 87.6%. The study revealed that 353 inmates(80.6%) utilise photocopying services, 322 inmates(73.5%) utilise journals, 311 inmates(71.0%) utilise Book loan services, 237 inmates (54.1%) utilise past examination questions, 211 inmates(50.5%) utilise West African Examinations Council curricula and syllabi, while 320 inmates(73.1%) claimed that staff attitude was not a hindrance to their utilisation of the library resources. Also, 79.0% claimed that weekend opening was not a challenge to their utilisation of library media resources, 83.6% do not see non-book loan as a challenge and 90.4% equally do not see library opening hours as a hindrance. However, 268 inmates (61.2%) claimed that they do not utilise the general reading materials and 312 inmates(71.2%) do not utilise the prescribed (recommended) textbooks. Recommendations were made accordingly as deduced from the findings.
link.keywords: Utilisation of library media resources, Prison inmates in Nigeria, Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination.

link.heading: Exploring Factors for the Adherence of Library Rules and Regulations at Central University of South Bihar
link.authorDes: Assistant Librarian (In-charge), Central Library, Central University of South Bihar Camp Office: BIT Campus, PO-BV College, Patna-800 014, (M): 7301672752
link.abstract: The paper deals with an explorative study of the factors responsible for the adherence of library rules and regulations at Central University of South Bihar. For the study questionnaire based survey method was used that was structured using the 4 point likert scale. From an exhaustive literature review six criteria: user education, information resource availability, attitude of the library staffs, library working hours and disciplinary as well as security measures were taken for the study. Average mean of 2.50 was used as a cut-off point for the study. Out of the six factors under study: user education, information resource availability, attitude of the library staffs, library working hours, disciplinary as well as security measures five factors are strong determinant for the adherence to library rules and regulations. Over a period of time impact of library rules and regulations over the users have remained a neglected topic. The present study is an attempt to fill the void and find out the factors that are responsible for the adherence of library rules and regulations in a university library. Based on the findings suggestions have been proposed which could be taken into concern for strong adherence among students of the library rules and regulations.
link.keywords: library rules and regulations, academic library, Central University of South Bihar, user education, information resource availability, library working hours, disciplinary, security measures.

link.heading: Koha Web OPAC-Customizing it to Make a Library Portal-A Case Study of Assam University Library
link.authors: Sharma AK1, Tripathi DP2, Mishra Vinod K3
link.authorDes: 1Librarian, Assam University, Silchar-788011 (Email: arun2929@gmail.com)2Assistant Librarian, National Institute of Technology, Rourkela-(Email: dptnitrkl@gmail.com)3Assistant, Librarian, National Institute of Technology, Rourkela-(Email: mishravk79@gmail.com)
link.abstract: Koha is one of the most popular open source software worldwide due to its user friendliness, free availability and regular upgradations. Also, the need based customization makes this software more powerful and likable among the librarians as well as the users as with a little knowledge of html script its WebOPAC can be made more interactive and personal. The WebOPAC customization feature of the Koha can be used by the librarians without having much knowledge of the html codes or web page designing. The present paper gives a case study of the WebOPAC of Rabindra Library-Central Library of Assam University. The customization done at the Assam University is totally need based and still complete features and options are not utilized to make it more attractive, however, modification of the WebOPAC is a continuous process and after using more options, the WebOPAC will be made more beautiful and interactive. In this paper an effort has been made to share the experience of Assam University so that other library professionals can customize their WebOPAC and take their library resources to the users’ desktop.
link.keywords: Koha, WebOPAC, Library Automation, OSS, Open Source Software.

link.heading: Biobibliometric Study of Professor A. S. Paintal: A Celebrated Medical Physiologist
link.authors: Koley Susanta1, Dr Sen B K2,3
link.authorDes: 1Librarian, Central Library, Durgapur Institute of Advanced Technology & Management, GT Road, Rajbandh, Durgapur, Burdwan, West Bengal, E-mail: shayanikoley.2013@gmail.com2Chairman, Expert Committee on Bibliometrics, DST, Government of India Member, Research Council on History of Science, Indian National Science Academy Formerly-Scientist, CSIR3Visiting Professor, University of Malaya, Project Investigator-Indian National Science Academy, Postal Address: 80 Shivalik Apartments, Alaknanda, New Delhi-110019, India. E-mail: bksen1938@gmail.com
link.abstract: Prof. A. S. Paintal, is recognized as a towering figure in the field of cardio-respiratory sensory physiology. His 129 publications appeared during 1952–2005 were analyzed to find out year-wise distribution of papers, research team of the scientist and scattering of papers in different communication channels. This study also finds author productivity, spectrum of research activities and productivity of Paintal's research team. Most of the papers of the scientist (N= 86) are noncollaborative. Paintal's first paper was published in1952 at the age of 26. The period 1971–1980, when Paintal was 46–55 years old, was his most productive period (3 papers per year). In the byline of authors his status ranged from first author to sixth author. Paintal's research team comprised 28 collaborators. Asima Anand was the most productive collaborator of the scientist. Most of his papers were published in international journals, and Journal of Physiology (London) was the most preferred journal. Finally, it is seen that the data set does not follow Bradford Law.
link.keywords: Biobibliometrics, Informetrics, Scientometrics, A S Paintal, Medical physiologist, Medical scientist, FRS, Cardio-respiratory sensory physiology, Collaboration in research.

link.heading: Studies on Relative Growth Rate and Doubling Time of Publications of CSIR-NEERI, India during 1989–2013
link.authors: Lohiya Rajesh Kumar1, Cyriac Jiji2, Sengar K P S3
link.authorDes: 1Library Officer, CSIR-NEERI, Nagpur (KRC, CSIR-NEERI), E-mail-rk_lohiya@neeri.res.in, Mob. No. 094228248262Documentation Officer, ICAR-NBSS & LUP, Nagpur3Library Officer, CSIR-IMTECH, Chandigarh
link.abstract: The present paper deals with the analysis of Relative Growth Rate and Doubling Time of productivity of research articles of CSIR-NEERI, India during 1989–2013. The data used for the study were retrieved from Web of Science database for the period of twenty fiveyears from 1989 to 2013. The results indicate that the growth of research has steadily increased from 9 articles in 1989 to 117 in 2011& 2012 and again decreased in the year 2013 (81 articles). The mean value of RGR of articles (0.104), pages (0.085) & Citations (0.066) and Dt of articles (4.277), pages (83.010) & citations (−12.150) respectively. Relative Growth Rate (RGR) and Doubling Time (Dt) of CSIR-NEERI publications during the study period exhibits a fluctuating trend.
link.keywords: CSIR-NEERI, Doubling Time (Dt), Environmental Engineering and Science, Relative Growth Rate (RGR), Research Productivity.

link.heading: Training and Education of Cataloguers in the University Libraries of Nepal
link.authorDes: Librarian, National Forensic Science Laboratory, Kathmandu, Nepal
link.abstract: This paper attempts to find out the real situation of cataloging practices, the status of the cataloguers, their attitude towards cataloguing and their training needs specially in the university libraries of Nepal in the automated library environment. The study focuses on the training and education facilities available to the cataloguers in the university libraries in Nepal. It also brings out the challenges and difficulties faced by cataloguers, and their attitudes towards cataloguing work and their training needs.
link.keywords: Authority work, cataloguers, cataloguing, MARC coding, subject cataloguing, university libraries, Nepal.

link.heading: Use Pattern of Electronic Resources by the Research Scholars: A Case Study of CCS Haryana Agriculture University, Hissar, India
link.authorDes: M. Phil Scholar, Department of Library and Information Science, Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra-136119, Email: ias.ahlawat@gmail.com
link.abstract: This paper aims to examine the use pattern of electronic resources among the research scholars of Chaudhary Charan Singh Haryana Agriculture University, as provided by the Nehru Central Library of the University by using the survey method. The study found that all the research scholars are using library e-resources specifically for research work and e-journals (83%) are most used resources. However, majority of them use e-resources and printed material equally and need training regarding information retrieval and discipline specific search. CeRA (Consortium for e-Resources in Agriculture) and KrishiPrabha e-Theses, DOAJ, Agricola, sources on educational and bibliographical information and encyclopaedias are most used e-resources by the research scholars. Slow access speed in reaching the needed e-resource and difficulty in downloading are the major problems in accessing the e-resources. This study offers the suggestions for further improvement of access of electronic resources to fulfil the research needs of scholars.
link.keywords: Electronic Resources, Research Scholars, Agricultural Universities, University Library, User Study, Electronic Media.

link.heading: Designing and Development of A Subject Gateway in The Field of Ayurveda
link.authorDes: 1Shri Ram College of Commerce Library, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India, vikas.singh@srcc.du.ac.in2Deputy Librarian, Central Library, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India, rajeshzone29@yahoo.co.in
link.abstract: This paper is an outcome of the study made for designing and development of an Ayurveda subject gateway with a purpose to enlighten and strengthen the knowledge of Ayurvedic people. The paper explains the complete process of creating a Subject Gateway. The Dream Weaver/Ms-Front Page Software/HTML web authoring tools along with Photoshop and Paint software have been also used for modification, sharpening and improving the quality of graphics used in construction of Subject Gateway and PDF Acrobat professional software has been used to convert various file formats into PDF. Present gateway is trying to satisfy the information hunger of the professionals as well as the Scholars of the Ayurvedic People. It is believed that the present gateway is highly authentic and useful with the oceans of information at one place, reduces the burden of Ayurvedic scholars by giving needful links in the present electronic environment with the help of familiar language. This portal will also prove to be an effective means of conveyance and make information handy and accessible. The findings of the study will not only guide librarians and other new comer but also Researchers or other professionals to design and develop Gateway in other disciplines.
link.keywords: Research Library, Ayurveda, Gateways, Portal, India.

link.heading: Perception of Distance Learners About The Use of Library: A Case Study of IGNOU Learners
link.authors: Singh Ramneek1, Ghosh DR C K2
link.authorDes: 1Semi Professional Assistant, Indira Gandhi National Open University, IGNOU Regional Centre Delhi-3, Shaheed Ramphal Chowk, Sector-7, New Delhi-110077. Email: ignourc3.spa@gmail.com2Regional Director, Indira Gandhi National Open University, IGNOU Regional Centre Delhi-3, Shaheed Ramphal Chowk, Sector-7, New Delhi-110077. Email: ckghosh@ignou.ac.in
link.abstract: Distance education provides convenient time and space independent learning environment. As a part of support services provided by distance learning institutions libraries play an important role in dissemination of information resources to distance learners. However, here it becomes essential to know the opinion or perception of distance learners about the library resources and services, and their preference to use library for the academic needs. So the present study attempts to know the perception of IGNOU graduate and postgraduate students regarding library services. The study also analyses the frequency of visiting the library by the learners and satisfaction derived from the various services at IGNOU libraries. The study revealed that students lack awareness about the library services, prefer to purchase help-books rather than consulting reference books and most students do not prefer to visit the library at all.
link.keywords: Distance Education, User Studies, Library Services, Needs Assessment, Universities, IGNOU Library System, Distance Learners, Perception.

link.heading: Enabling Technologies of Access to E-resources: An Overview
link.authorDes: Librarian, Deen Dayal Upadhyaya College, (University of Delhi), Karampura, New Delhi-110015, Email: sinhaabhijeet@yahoo.com Mob. 09312227995
link.abstract: This article is an attempt to explain and summarize the technical functionalities involved in access to e-resources. E-resources such as e-books, e-journals and databases have become preferred choice of users due to their characteristic features. It has become important to understand their structural functionalities in order to exploit them to the fullest. E-resources are required to be embedded with linking tools such as Cross Ref; DOI, DOI-X, Open URL and Link Resolver for maximum outreach and usability. The scholarly content are further disseminated through range of access technology such as Generic password, IP Access, Proxy Server, Virtual Private Network, Athens and Shibboleth Authentication to make them more accessible any time anywhere. Cloud computing based IT infrastructure is yet another promising proposition for libraries delivering services at cost effective operational models with reduced complexity. These components of ICT prove to be crucial tool in providing wider access to e-resources. Appropriate deployment of technical resources can make the move of libraries towards electronic collection sustainable.
link.keywords: Electronic Resources, Library Consortium, Linking tools, Access technology, Cloud Computing, INFLIBNET.

link.heading: Dental Clinics of North America 2004–2014: A Bibliometric Study
link.authorDes: 1Librarian, Maulana Azad Institute of Dental Sciences, MAMC Complex, BSZ Marg, Delhi-1100022Reader, School of Social Sciences, Indira Gandhi National Open University, Maidan Garhi, Delhi
link.abstract: Bibliometric analysis of 539 articles published in the journal titled “Dental Clinics of North America” during 2004 to 2014 has been carried out. The paper analysed yearwise distribution of paper, average length of paper, authorship pattern, bibliographic form of documents, distribution of citations and subject trends of articles. The result shows that the journal on an average has published 49 research articles per year and most of the papers were contributed by two authors. Most of the articles dealt with general dentistry. The average length of the paper is 17 pages per article and journals are the most predominant form of citations.
link.keywords: Bibliometrics, Citation, Authorship pattern, Bibliographical form, DCNA, Dentistry.

link.heading: Role of Libraries in Research Productivity of Social Science Research Institutions: A Case Study
link.authorDes: 1Deputy Librarian, Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics, prabhashrath@yahoo.com2Librarian, Sardar Patel Institute of Economic and Social Research, saritaranga09@gmail.com
link.abstract: In India, research in Social Science dates back to the establishment of Universities across the country but the pace of research actually accelerated with the establishment of Indian Council for Social Science Research (ICSSR) in 1969. At present, research in Social Science is carried out in different categories of organizations such as specialized research institutions, Universities, Deemed to be Universities, Social Science departments in Institutes of National Importance such as IITs, IIMs etc. With a backdrop argument that libraries play a vital role in research output of social science research institutions, this paper tried to find out the use of libraries by researchers attached to two major social science research institutions in India, viz. the Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics (GIPE) and Sardar Patel Institute of Economic and Social Research (SPIESR) by studying the extent of availability of resources in libraries of these two research institutions out of the total number of citations of the publications of the faculty members of these two institutions. It was found that the percentage of availability of cited resources is not encouraging in the libraries of these two institutions and the percentage of availability of cited resources by respective faculty members of these two institutions is more in SPIESR when compared with GIPE.
link.keywords: Social Science Research, Role of Libraries, India, Library Use, Open Access.

link.heading: Students’ Usage and Experiences of Web 2.0 Technologies
link.authors: Yadav Akhilesh K S1, Vohra Niharika2
link.authorDes: 1Assistant Professor, Centre for Library and Information Management Studies, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Deonar, P.O. Box 8313, Mumbai-400 088, India, Email: akhilesh.yadav@tiss.edu2Centre for Library and Information Management Studies, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Deonar, P.O. Box 8313, Mumbai-400 088, India, Email: akhilesh.yadav@tiss.edu
link.abstract: The main purpose of this study was to obtain information on how the students use the web tools and technologies and how much it affects their education. This paper aims to present the results of a survey research that investigated post-graduate students at Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai, India. This survey research is done through a quantitative approach by using the questionnaire as a tool for data collection. The researchers designed the questionnaire with open-ended and closeended questions and distributed to post-graduate students. The data analysis revealed that major purpose to use the web tools by the students is for professional activities like finding relevant materials, sharing with friends and promoting their research. This is positive sign that students are focused and use the Web 2.0 tools for educational purpose. Students feel that privacy is the major concern for them. This study is limited to examine the students’ usage and experiences of Web 2.0 tools by small group of post-graduate students of TISS, Mumbai. Therefore, the results should not be generalized in different settings to describe all students’ experiences of the use of Web 2.0 tools. This research study gives a clear picture of students and their use of web 2.0 tools in their education. This research can be helpful to the fraternities so as to help students understand the importance of these tools. Their awareness level about the tools can be observed and can be improved.
link.keywords: Web 2.0, Web tools, Social Media, Social Networking, Communication tools, Educational tools.

link.heading: Perceptions of LIS Professionals Towards Podcasting Technology: ASurvey
link.authorDes: Deputy Librarian, University of Kota, Kota, (Rajasthan) Email: drkaushikanna@gmail.com
link.abstract: This study aims to provide perceptions of library and information science professionals towards adoption, use, assessment and future perspective of podcasting technology. The results of this study revealed that majority of the LIS professionals who participated in this survey are working in academic libraries as librarians and engaged for more than two years in podcasting technology due to increasing use of mobile technologies. Lack of skills, nine steps as mentioned in figure number-7, and appropriate infrastructure development were found critical issues for adopting, evaluating and augmenting of podcasting technology. This technology will be fully used by LIS professionals for various purposes at very high level. This study may be helpful to find different views and insights of LIS professionals who are connected to the podcasting technology.
link.keywords: LIS professionals, Podcast, Podcasting, Perception, Survey, Amazing technology.

link.heading: Publishers of LIS Books in India: A Study
link.authors: Dr Dadhe Pooja P.1, Kesarwani S K2,3
link.authorDes: 1Assistant Librarian, Dr. V.B. alias Bhausaheb Kolte Library, Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University, Nagpur, 440010 E-mail: ppdadhe@gmail.com2Sr. Assistant Director, Library and Documentation Division (Retd.), National Environmental Engineering Research Institute, Nagpur3Present Address: 72-B, Tapovan Complex, Jai Prakash Nagar, Nagpur, 440025
link.abstract: The study aims to find-out contributions of publishers in India towards the growth of LIS literature, in terms of publications of books. The paper mentions vital role of a publisher as a link between author, book, library and readers. It discusses briefly the nature and functions of publishing. Presents overview of LIS books publishing in India since publication of first book on library science till the end of 2000. Based on an inventory prepared of publishers containing bibliographical details of books published by each, pertaining to the period 2001 to 2010, analysis has been done highlighting ranking of publishers in terms of total number of titles published, city wise distribution of these publishers, publishers preferred by prolific authors etc. Concludes that, with large number of publishers taking interest in publication of LIS books, there is no hurdle for publication of books for present day authors as it prevailed during forties and fifties, when the publishers were hesitant to take up publication of library science books. The prospective authors of today have ample scope to choose the publishers.
link.keywords: Book Publishing, LIS books, India, Publishers’ role, Nature of Publishing.

link.heading: Attitude of Personal Information Management Among Research Scholars: A Study on University of Kerala
link.authors: Divya L R1, Sudhier K G Pillai2
link.authorDes: 1Research Scholar, Department of Library and Information Science, University of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram, 695034. E-mail: divyalr.geo@gmail.com2Librarian, Library & Knowledge Centre, School of Distance Education, University of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram, 695034. E-mail: kgsudhier@gmail.com
link.abstract: This paper aims to understand the attitude and skills of Personal Information Management (PIM) among research scholars of Faculty of Applied Sciences in the University of Kerala. PIM refers to a set of activities a person performs in order to acquire, create, store, organize, maintain, retrieve, use and distribute personal information for different purposes. The study is based on a questionnaire survey of research scholars of the six departments under the Faculty of Applied Science at University of Kerala. A structured questionnaire was designed for the data collection on the basis of objectives of the study. Questionnaire consists of both optional type questions and statements in five point Lickert scale. The study includes the full time research scholars under the Faculty of Applied Science at University of Kerala. Out of the 59 respondents, 69.60% females and 30.40% male scholars are using their lap tops for managing personal information. The study attempts to identify various factors such as age, gender and qualification of the research scholars. Majority of the respondents agreed that they know more about managing their personal information and apply it on research work and it helps to present papers. The study revealed that 49.15% research scholars agreed that PIM helps them to present papers and motivate research work.The findings of the study indicate that the respondents find difficulties in updating. Analysis also showed that most of the research scholars have above average skills on information searching and maintenance. The paper highlights the attitude of research scholars towards personal information management.
link.keywords: Personal Information Management, Skills, Attitude, PIM Tools, University of Kerala.

link.heading: News
Preventing The Plague of Plagiarism
link.authorDes: UGC Emeritus Fellow (2011–2013), Guru Nanak Dev University, Amritsar-143005, E-mail: satija_mp@yahoo.com
link.abstract: Defines plagiarism as any unethical act of copyright infringement. States it is widespread all over the world in academics and other creative fields such as research, art, movies and music. Explores its origin and states its causes and ill effects. Suggests some preventive and curative measures to curb it. Gives details of academic, administrative and technological solutions to check this growing menace. Names some anti-plagiarism software to detect it. Projects Information literacy as the best means to eradicate it. Highlights the role of librarians in educating users against plagiarism
link.keywords: Academic ethics, Academic frauds, Anti-plagiarism software, Copyright infringement, Information literacy, Intellectual property rights(IPR), Plagiarism, Scientific misconduct.

link.heading: Scientometric Assessment of Climate Change Data
link.authors: Prof. Husain Shabahat*, Mushtaq DR. Muzamil1
link.authorDes: 1Department of Library and Information Science, Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh India, Email: naikoomuzamil@gmail.com
link.abstract: The present study analyses 17, 266 publications records on different aspects of climate change published during 2009–2013. The highest (4788) publications were produced in the year 2013 and the lowest (2238) was in the year 2009. The highest number of publications was produced by USA followed by England. Thuiller, W followed by Smith, P. were the most prolific authors in the field of climate change. The journal articles were the most widely used document forms followed by reviews. The prolific journals were ‘Climatic change’ and ‘Global change biology’. The study also assessed the citation patterns including the country's citations, citations of affiliated institutes, and average, self and unique citations received of select years.
link.keywords: Climate change; environment sciences; ecology; scientometric study; Citation analysis; research assessment.

link.heading: Promoting Health Literacy in India Through Social Networks: Opportunities and Challenges
link.authors: Narang Sangeeta1,,*, Shukla Archana2, Sen B K3
link.authorDes: 1National Drug Dependence Treatment Centre and Department of Psychiatry, All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Ansari Nagar, New Delhi-1100292Assistant Professor, Library and Information Science, School of Social Sciences, Indira Gandhi National Open University, Maidan Garhi, New Delhi-110067 Email: archana@ignou.ac.in3Chairman, Bibliometrics Expert Committee, Department of Science and Technology, Member, Research Council, History of Science, Indian National Science Academy, New Delhi, Email: bksen1938@gmail.com
link.abstract: Health literacy is a person's ability to access, understand, communicate and apply health-related information wisely. Social media service platforms are gaining popularity in connecting, informing, educating and disseminating information to online communities on varied aspects. In health care sector, the WHO, NLM, NHS and various other organizations are providing information globally to people on health and safety issues, health education programmes, etc. through social networks like Facebook and YouTube. This paper reviews relevant literature available on the Google Scholar and the PubMed database on Health Literacy and Social Networks. It also surveys the websites of top ten medical institutions of the world and top ten medical colleges of India to find out their acceptance of social media tools. It is observed that in India social media tools and their adoption by medical colleges have not been exploited much in comparison with the top ten medical institutions of the world and our literature on health literacy is scanty. Considering India's large population, low health literacy, woeful shortage of doctors in rural areas, language and communication barriers, and so on it is suggested that the medical institutions must incorporate social media tools on their websites and promote health literacy-based education. This will connect health professionals with communities and thereby promote health literacy. The need for well-designed social network policies at every medical institution and creation of guides, tutorials and mobile applications has been stressed. These will help people to understand health terminologies and concepts as well as causes, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in general. Risks associated with the health information quality on social networks have also been addressed.
link.keywords: Health care, Health information, Health literacy, Social networks, Web 2.0.

link.heading: Impact of Orientation Programme on University Freshmen: The Example of Federal University Oye-Ekiti, Nigeria
link.authorDes: Principal Librarian, Fuoye Library, Federal University, Oye-Ekiti, Ekiti State, Nigeria, E-Mail: iobusayo@yahoo.com, Isaac.busayo@fuoye.edu.ng
link.abstract: The study surveys the impact of orientation programme on university freshmen at the Federal University Oye-Ekiti, Ekiti State, Nigeria. A sample of two hundred questionnaires was administered on the freshmen across the four Faculties of the University namely: Agriculture, Engineering, Humanities and Social Sciences and Science, with a response rate of 197, representing 98.5%. The findings revealed that orientation was educative, enlightening and interactive and it allowed for question and answer opportunity. The results further showed that direct contact and familiarity with the Principal Officers of the university is ensured while accommodation and other challenges of freshmen are addressed. Orientation programme/tours equally allow for the familiarity of freshmen with the institution. As to whether orientation was a waste of time, 193 respondents (96.5%) disagreed while 4 respondents (2%) agreed. Likewise, on whether orientation should be cancelled, 195 respondents (97.5%) said no while only 2 respondents (1%) said yes. In like manner, 192 respondents (96%) claimed that orientation talks/speeches motivate and encourage freshmen but 5 respondents (2.5%) disagreed. However, 193 respondents (96.5%) opined that orientation should be held consistently annually for freshmen while 4 respondents (2%) were against this opinion/option. Recommendations were made as appropriate in line with the findings to enhance and sustain orientation programme in tertiary institutions in Nigeria.
link.keywords: Impact, Orientation Programme, University Freshmen, Nigeria.

link.heading: Content To Connectivity: Paradigm Shifts in Knowledge Innovation, Information Representation, Information Management Systems and Librarianship†
link.authorDes: 1Ex-Chief Scientist, CSIR-National Institute of Science, Technology and Development Studies (CSIR-NISTADS), New Delhi, 110 012, E-mail: gargkc022@gmail.com2Department of Library and Information Science, University of Delhi, Delhi, 110 007, E-mail: bebi.mywork@gmail.com
link.abstract: An analysis of 74 papers presented at “Content to Connectivity: Paradigm Shifts in Knowledge Innovation, Information Representation, Information Management Systems and Librarianship” organized by TECNIA Institute of Advanced Studies (TIAS) and Satija Research Foundation For Library And Information Sciences (SRFLIS) on April 11–12, 2014 at Delhi indicates that about half of the papers were authored by single authors and rest were written in co-authorship. Only a small proportion of papers were co-authored. Most of the co-authored papers were presented by scholars from the schools of library and information science. Of all the authors about one-fourth were women scholars. Among all the contributing institutions, Department of Library and Information Science of the University of Delhi ranked first. Indian authors cite journals originating from USA and UK as compared to Indian journals.
link.keywords: Bibliometrics, Conferences, Library and Information Science, Authorship pattern.

link.heading: Use of E-resources in The Parliament Library of India: A Study
link.authors: Dr Joshi Taruna1, Dr Singh Jnanendra Narayan2, Jagriti*
link.authorDes: 1Librarian, Ramjas College, University of Delhi, Delhi, 110007, Email: tjnssvcl@yahoo.com2Librarian, Dyal Singh (E) College, Lodhi Road, New Delhi, 110003. Email: jnanendranarayansingh@gmail.com
link.abstract: Parliamentary libraries serve parliamentary institutions on a national or local level. The Parliament Library of India was established in 1921. E-Directories, E-Reports, E-Databases, Documentation, E-books, E-Audio books, and E-Journals are the eresources subscribed by the Parliament Library of India. This survey focuses on the use of electronic resources of the Parliament by the Members of Parliament (MPs) and staff members. It was found that the e-resources are extensively used as part of the daily work by MPs and staff. But there are a number of obstacles to using eresources. Survey results greatly assist in gaining a better understanding of users’ awareness, usage, and preferences regarding e-resources. E-resources which are used most should continue to be purchased and those which are not used much should be dropped.
link.keywords: E-Resources, E-Directories, E-Reports, E-Databases, E-News Clipping, E-books, E-Audio books & E-Journals.

link.heading: Marketing of Library and Information Science Products and Services Through Social Media-Need of The Hour
link.authors: M Kumar anish1, Dr. Singh K P2
link.authorDes: 1Assistant Professor, Department of Library & Information Science, University of Delhi, Delhi2Associate Professor, Department of Library & Information Science, University of Delhi
link.abstract: Technology has changed the spectrum of service oriented organizations to impress, assess and quench the quests of information seekers. To harness the dynamic technological changes, it is inevitable for libraries to use social media tools for marketing their library and information science products and services. Accordingly by accepting and adopting these new means, the information hubs can outreach and tap those potential or casual information seekers who due to reluctance or any other good reason are still not approaching and using the wide array of library products and services.
link.keywords: Library and Information Science, Library Products and Services, Marketing of Library Products and Services, Social Media, Marketing.

link.heading: Need For Regulation of Environmental Condition in Preservation of Library Collection in Tropical Area: Problem Faced at Sriniketan, Birbhum District of West Bengal
link.authorDes: Palli Samgathana Vibhaga Library, Sriniketan, Visva-Bharati, West Bengal. E-mail: atanu_sinha77@yahoo.com
link.abstract: Weather poses a serious threat to the library collection of all types. Knowing the environmental conditions in a library/archive is essential for planning the best strategy for the preservation of collections effectively. In order to control temperature and relative humidity at a fixed level, these should be measured and recorded systematically. The present study deals with the objectives of finding out the month-wise average temperature (both maximum and minimum) and relative humidity, all time record of temperature and relative humidity of the area under study, month-wise average sunlight hours of the area under study for the last ten years (2005–2014). Gives an outline about the reasons of deterioration of library collection, and proposes curative measures of the library collection anywhere in tropical areas, with special reference to Sriniketan, Birbhum district of West Bengal. Discusses some major guidelines for regulating environmental conditions in preserving library collection. The study is based on the ten years data collected from the Meteorological Department, Sriniketan, West Bengal. Annual Reports of Visva-Bharati have been used for collecting data like library collection, year of establishment, area of library. From the data analysis it was found that maximum temperature was 45.9ºC on April 04, 2010 and minimum was 4.9OC on January 01, 2013. Relative humidity remains 58 to 85 in Sriniketan. During the period of study average lowest humidity was 58.15% in March and average highest humidity was 85.54% in September. A maximum sunlight hour was 11.2 hours on August 09, 2007. Findings of the study may help the authority of libraries of Visva-Bharati Library Network as well as respective Bhavan Administration to adopt the appropriate measures towards controlling temperature, relative humidity, etc. to protect their valuable library collection.
link.keywords: Deterioration, Library Collection, Climatic Condition, Meteorological Data, Meteorological Observatory, Sriniketan, Visva-Bharati Library Network.

link.heading: Getting Into The Reality: The Experience of Physical Facilities Provided by The Public Libraries in Darjeeling Hill
link.authors: Dr Karkee Prabin1, Prof Majumder Krishnapada2
link.authorDes: 1Librarian, Siliguri College, PO-Siliguri, District Darjeeling, Email: prawin_lis@rediffmail.com2Department of Library & Information Science, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, Email: krishnapada_majumder@yahoo.com
link.abstract: Among the three important components of any public library viz. collection, user and library building, the building has an important role to play. This article highlights the present status of library buildings, space allocation, and other physical facilities provided by the government and government sponsored public libraries in the hilly areas of Darjeeling district of West Bengal. Taking into account the geographical factor, the study stressed to cover various aspects of library physical facilities which are vital for providing effective library services in the region. A structured questionnaire was circulated to all the 101 government and government sponsored Public Libraries serving the hilly areas, out of which 94 questionnaires were duly obtained with a response rate of 93%. Effort was also made to physically visit the libraries to collect data. Based on the findings, the study presents some recommendations for the development of effective public library services in the hilly region.
link.keywords: Public Library Services, Library Physical Facilities, Library Building, Library Space, Darjeeling Hill.

link.heading: Getting started with information technology: Practice and Applications
link.authorDes: Deptt. of Lib. & Info. Sc. RTMNU, Nagpur & Rtd. Sr. Grade Scientist & Head of Information Division, National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI), Nagpur

link.heading: News & Events
Win by Reading More and Playing More: Information of Sports Persons
link.authors: Dr. Gill Jatinder Singh*, Prof (Retd) Satija MP**
link.authorDes: *Assistant Librarian, Guru Nanak Dev University, Amritsar-143 005**UGC Emeritus Fellow, Department of Library and Information Science, Guru Nanak Dev University, Amritsar-143 005
link.abstract: This study is an attempt to know about information seeking pattern of the sports persons and sports scientists of Delhi and Punjab. Motilal Nehru School of Sports, Rai, Sonipat (Haryana) is a special inclusion. It investigates their purpose, frequency, modes and channels of seeking information, use of library sources and services especially in the context of use of Information Technology. This survey based study is illustrated with data tables and visual charts.
link.keywords: Information seeking, Physical education, Sports, Sports information systems, Sports persons.

link.heading: Institutional Repositories (IRs) in The Major R&D Libraries of Kolkata and Surrounding Areas: A Case Study
link.authors: Dutta Shyamasree*, Prof Panda K C**
link.authorDes: *Ph D Scholar, Library & Information Science, Sambalpur University, (Odisha)**Former Professor, Head & Dean, Department of Library & Information Science, Sambalpur University, (Odisha)
link.abstract: Institutional Repositories are recognized as the essential infrastructure with the mechanism to store, preserve, identify and retrieve the intellectual collections including research output of the academic communities of a single institution or multi-institutions in digital form which play a crucial role in the research life cycle. IRs are becoming prevalent in the academic sector with the rapid changes in technology, scholarly practices and patron expectations. Academic institutions are grappling to create functional IRs to facilitate the growth in teaching, learning and research. UGC (2005) in India has already developed a policy document on building Digital Repositories at University Level. National Knowledge Commission (2007) strongly advocated archiving research literature for building nation wide Institutional Repository. This paper tries to explore the actual scenario of Institutional Repositories in different R&D libraries of Kolkata and surrounding areas.
link.keywords: Institutional Repositories, IR software, Open source institutional repository system, major R&D Libraries, Kolkata.

link.heading: Development of Digital Library by Using GSDL in Library 2.0 Environment: A Practical Approach
link.authors: Dr. Saha Nimai Chand*, Mr. Suman DE**
link.authorDes: *Deputy Librarian, Visva-Bharati, Sanitniketan, West Bengal, 731 235, India. E-mail: ncsaha.72@gmail.com, nimaichand.saha@visva-bharati.ac.in**Librarian, Dhansimla Vidyabhawan (HS), Dhansimla, Sonamukhi, Bankura, West Bengal, India E-mail: sumandey100@gmail.com
link.abstract: For the development of a digital library, the pre-requisite factor is installation of the required software. There is great hesitation and doubt among the library professionals about the steps and procedures for the successful running of the same. The main purpose of this paper is to explore a practical guide for the development of digital library along with the installation of the required software. For the development of a digital library, the information bearing objects are available freely from the publicly indexable World Wide Web by utilizing freeware like Apache as web server, PERL packages and modules and GSDL as digital library software. Paper also traces out the application of Dublin Core Metadata Elements Set (DCMES) for resource description and resource discovery in distributed information environment. Libraries of all kinds may follow the procedures as suggested in the study along with the software and they can easily and simply develop their digital library in a cost effective manner. The study may be extended to design value added e-Info services accessible through web and as datasets on CD ROM and it is as good as demonstration of entire steps of digital library development.
link.keywords: Digital Collection Development, Digital Library, Greenstone Digital Library Software, Dublin Core Metadata Schema, Web 2.0, Library 2.0.

link.heading: Indian Contribution to Open Access Scholarly Publishing in Science and Technology: A Critical Study of Directory of open Access Journals (DOAJ)
link.authorDes: *Associate Professor, Department of Library and Information Science, University of Delhi, Mob-09818057510**Assistant, Librarian, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IITD), New Delhi
link.abstract: Open Access movement is gaining momentum around the world and India is also actively participating in this movement. This paper presents a detailed study of Indian contribution to Open Access Scholarly Publishing in Science and Technology indexed in DOAJ. The research highlights the various dimensions related to the open access scholarly communication in S&T such as chronological growth, publisher wise and subject-wise contributions, etc. Further the study finds that about 2302 S&T journals from the top ten countries of the world are available as open access through DOAJ out of them about 312 journals are available as open access.
link.keywords: Open Access, Open Access Journals, Open Access Journals-Science and Technology, Indian Open Access Initiatives, Open Access Scholarly Literature, DOAJ.

link.heading: Bibliometrics of Postgraduate Dissertations and Doctoral Theses submitted to Indira Gandhi Agricultural University (IGAU) during 1971-2010
link.authors: Dr Garg K C*, Saini Vasundhara**
link.authorDes: *Ex-Chief Scientist, CSIR-National Institute of Science, Technology and Development Studies (CSIR-NISTADS), New Delhi-110 012, E-mail: gargkc022@gmail.com**Librarian (Contractual), Government Boys Senior Secondary School, Azadpur Colony, Delhi-110 033, E-mail: vasundhrasaini@yahoo.com
link.abstract: An analysis of 1763 postgraduate and doctoral theses submitted to Indira Gandhi Agricultural University (IGAU) in departments of agricultural sciences, agricultural engineering and veterinary and animal husbandry during 1971-2010 indicates that the number of theses submitted increased steadily and reached a peak in the last block of 2006-2010. Most of the theses were submitted by male scholars and only 271 theses were submitted by female scholars. Also most of the supervisors were male. Highest number of theses was submitted in the department of agronomy followed by plant breeding and genetics. Professor S.K. Katiyar of the department of biotechnology and plant genetics and breeding supervised highest number of students.
link.keywords: Bibliometrics, Dissertations, Theses, Indira Gandhi Agricultural University, IGAU.

link.heading: How To Write A Technical Paper: A Mirror
link.authorDes: *Library Officer, CSIR-Central Building Research Institute, Roorkee247 667. senapati@cbri.res.in
link.abstract: Enumerates all steps one by one and discusses them for writing a technical paper. Elaborates salient features of a research article. Discusses the different bibliographic standards and styles of citing references. Highlightes the present trends of publications in open access journals and Institutional Repositories.
link.keywords: Technical Paper, Research Methodology, Standards, Citing References, Basic Format, Publication Trends, Open Access, Institutional Repository.

link.heading: S R Ranganathan: Combining Library Science With Indian Values
link.authorDes: Assistant Professor, Department of Library Science, MLB Government College of Excellence, Gwalior474 009. E-mail: arvindksharma23@gmail.com
link.abstract: This article deals with the Indian values and their impact on SR Ranganathan’s thoughts and contributions. Dr. Ranganathan has intertwined library science with Indian values. He quoted stanzas and sentences from Vedas, Brahmana Granthas, Upanishads, Ramayana, Mahabharata, Smriti literature, philosophical books, and other sacred books to combine library and information science with ancient Indian values. Ranganathan has given ‘108 facts to find’ in his book ‘Reference Service’. The total number of principle Upanishads is also 108. Ranganathan’s favourite book was “Ramayana” he quoted several examples from Ramayana. A full chapter is devoted to Ramayana in his book “Reference Service”. The name of chapter is ‘Light from Valmiki.’
link.keywords: Indian values, Library Science and SR Ranganathan.

link.heading: News & Events
Obituary
Awareness and use of UGC-INFONET E-resources among the PG female science students in Kuvempu University: A survey
link.authors: Dr Biradar B S*, Kumar D Vinay**
link.authorDes: *Professor, Department of Library and Information Science, Kuvempu University, Jnana Sahyadri, Shankaraghatta, Email: bsbiradar53@rediffmail.com**Guest Lecturer, Department of Library and Information Science, Kuvempu University, Jnana Sahyadri, Shankaraghatta. Email: vinay.86.kumar@gmail.com
link.abstract: The paper aims to identify the needs and requirements of library users in general and to know the use of UGC-INFONET e-resources in the Kuvempu University by female students of science stream in particular. Study shows that 85% of student use UGC-INFONET e-resources. Paper highlights the problems of students in accessing UGC-INFONET consortium. It also tries to emphasize on users satisfaction towards this consortium.
link.keywords: E-resources, UGC-INFONET Consortium, Kuvempu University.

link.heading: Use of ICT Based Resources and Services Among the Users of Arts and Science Colleges in Virudhunagar District: A Study
link.authors: Velmurugan V. Senthur*, Dr. Amudha G.**
link.authorDes: *Librarian, n-Cardmath Library, Kalasalingam University, Krishnankovil - 626 126, Tamilnadu, India. Email: srisenthur85@gmail.com**Librarian, VHNSN College, Virudhunagar - 626 001, Tamilnadu, India
link.abstract: The present paper explains about the ICT resources and their use by the faculty members, research scholars and students in the Arts and Science colleges of Virudhunagar District. Developments in ICT have made significant impact on all spheres of human life. The data is collected through a questionnaire to study the information needs of the faculty members, research scholars and various students in Arts and Science colleges of Virudhunagar District. This paper describes the use of ICT based resources and services by the faculty members, research scholars and students. The paper also discusses the awareness adequacy, purpose, usefulness, and satisfaction level of using ICT based resources among the users of arts and science colleges in Virudhunagar District. ICT has introduced new methods of teaching and conducting research in education facilities for online learning, teaching and research collaboration. This paper has revealed that the ICTs available in Arts and Science Colleges in Virudhunagar District are more helpful in fulfilling their information needs. There is a need to train the faculty members, research scholars and students in use the ICT.
link.keywords: ICT, Internet, E- Resources, Arts and Science Colleges, Search Engines, E-journals and Digital Library.

link.heading: Information For Sustainable Agriculture: Assessment of Information Needs of Farmers in Koppal District, Karnataka State
link.authors: Parvathamma N.*, Kumar Vijaya**, Jameed Syed***
link.authorDes: *Professor, Department of Library & Information Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga- 585 106. Email-parvathi_glb@rediffmail.com**Research Scholar, Department of Library & Information Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga-585 106***Librarian, Sri Gavisiddeshwara Degree College, Koppal- 583 231
link.abstract: A survey of 240 farmers in Koppal district, Karnataka was undertaken to find out their socio-economic status, information channels and information sources used to satisfy their information needs during different stages of agriculture and marketing of the agricultural produce, which would help in developing appropriate information system and services. Data was collected through questionnaire, following simple random sampling. Findings show that majority of respondents are small scale farmers, dependent on rain for cultivation. Majority of them have completed five years of schooling and have annual income of less than Rs.10,000/-, which is below the per capita income of average Koppal district, Karnataka State and India. Paddy, Wheat and Maize are the main crops cultivated. Personal experience, fellow farmers and agricultural officers are the major sources of information consulted by farmers during different stages of cultivation, except during marketing of agricultural produce. Farmers depend upon officials of Agricultural Produce Marketing Centers (APMC) and Agents/Middlemen for marketing their agricultural produce. They depend upon Radio for meeting their information needs, only to a minimal extent.
link.keywords: Sustainable agriculture, sustainable practices in agriculture, agro climatic conditions, socio-economic status of farmers, Koppal district, marketing of the agricultural produce, channels and sources of information of farmers..

link.heading: Use of Search Engines for the Retrieval of Scholarly Information: A study of the Kerala University Library
link.authors: Sudhier K G*, Anitha C K**
link.authorDes: *Librarian, Library & Knowledge Centre, School Of Distance Education, University Of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram-695 034, Kerala. E-mail: kgsudhier@gmail.com**Librarian, Sree Buddha College of Engineering for Women, Elavumthitta, Pathanamthitta-689 503, Kerala E-mail: anitack2009@gmail.com
link.abstract: This paper focuses on the use of search engines by the users of the Kerala University Library. A survey was conducted through a structured questionnaire circulated among 250 library users taken from different categories and the response rate was 96 per cent. Stratified accidental random sample method was used for selection of respondents and interacting with them. The study revealed that students browse Internet for social, academic and professional purposes. All the researchers and teachers are using search engines for the retrieval of scholarly information for research purposes. Google is the most widely used search engine followed by yahoo and scirus. Majority of the students and teachers use search engines mainly for their study purposes and most of the research scholars use them for their research work. Most of the respondents are using search strategies and majority of them preferred field searching methods. Retrieval of too much unwanted information is the major hindrance faced while using search engines. The study highlights the practicality of the awareness and use of search engines for the retrieval of scholarly information and it will assist the policy makers, planners and the librarians to understand the user's awareness of the search engines and their use in the academic study and research.
link.keywords: Search engines, Information retrieval, Internet, Scholarly information, Kerala University library.

link.heading: Users Perception Towards the Use of Electronic Journals: A Study with Reference to University of Kashmir, Srinagar (India)
link.authorDes: Allama Iqbal Library, University of Kashmir, Srinagar -190 006. Email: manzoorha@gmail.com
link.abstract: This paper aims to explore the users’ perception towards the use of electronic journals (e-journals). A well structured questionnaire was designed to elicit the opinion of users. Responses were gathered from 160 users of the University of Kashmir. The results of the study provide information about preferred format and sources of reading articles, characteristics that affect the choice of e-format over print or print over e-format, purpose for which e-journals are used, problems faced by the users while accessing e-journals, features not currently supported in e-journals and expected features in future e-journals. On the basis of the findings, some suggestions have been put forth for maximizing the use of e-journals.
link.keywords: E-resources, E-journals, Print journals, Users perception, User study Kashmir University.

link.heading: Blog: An Innovative Tool For Electronic Reference Services In Libraries
link.authorDes: Assistant Professor, Department of Library and Information Science, Mizoram University, Aizawl (Mizoram) Email: manojdlisbhu@gmail.com
link.abstract: The technological developments in libraries have led to emergence of new type of service paradigms. It also has impact on reference services as electronic reference services for substantial implication for libraries. These implications keep very close to the history and mission of libraries. Reference services are receiving primary attention as librarians strategically position themselves to serve users who are entering in the library through both ways- physical and through electronic gateway. In present virtual era, libraries actively try to design, implement and market alternative reference services to meet users’ needs and retain their identity in present digital world. Now a days, many libraries are using different Library 2.0 tools (like RSS feeds, social networking sites, blogs etc.) to provide library services to the users. The paper deals with the use of Blogs in libraries to provide electronic reference services.
link.keywords: Online Real-Time Reference, Live Reference, Virtual Reference, Digital Reference, Online Reference, Electronic Reference, Reference Through Blog.

link.heading: Internship Programme in Library and Information Science: An Untapped Resource for Library Profession in India
link.authorDes: Ex. General Secretary, I L A, Ex. Librarian, VNC (D.U.), 160, Mall Apartments, Mall Road, Delhi-110054. Email: anugupta160@yahoo.com, Mob: 9818127241
link.abstract: Describes internship, its objective need and advantages. Advocates harnessing this resource area for the benefit of withering library profession. Stresses the need for standard curriculum content and definite period of training, provision for remuneration or stipend and award of certificate. Internship programme may lead to better availability of well equipped and trained library professionals and will increase the output of institution, with marginal expenditure. Describes the current scenario in the field, includes case study of Vivekananda College. (D.U.)
link.keywords: Internship, LIS Training, Experience, Library Profession, Library Services, Efficiency, Library professional.
